text.id: 10. nisomlet do kakawan a lima no kanakan
text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['10. nisomlet do kakawan a lima no kanakan', '卡在礁石洞的小手', 'The hand that got stuck in the coral reefs', '', 'si apen Yohani (F, 49, Iranmilek)', '江秀玉，女，49，東清村', '']

S.FORM: ya ko i-panci am, ni-mi-gowgaw so va-vahay noka-rako no keysakan.
S.TRANSL: 我要講的是，在海水大退潮時摸洞（捉螃蟹）的故事
My story is about a person who went to catch crabs during low tide.

S.FORM: iya rana ori am, aráko o keysakan am, ma-ngay do Kasngenan do keysakan ito a.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，海水退潮的時候，他就去Kasngenan海邊（捉螃蟹）
One day during low tide, he went to the sedgeland at Kasngenan to catch crabs.

S.FORM: mi-gowgaw so va-vahay am, ikongodo pangay-in na o lima na do va-vahay ori a ji máka-ngay ori am, agág-en na o lima na am, ji na rana agag-a.
S.TRANSL: 摸洞的時候，他的手本來就進不了那個洞，但他硬是把手伸進去，結果手進了洞以後就沒辦法抽回了
When he was probing the hole, he forced his hand in and stuck it in the (small) hole; therefore, when he wanted to pull it out, he couldn’t.

S.FORM: karaan am, ala to rana mi-igen o araw am, ji na pa a-hap o lima na.
S.TRANSL: 大概快到中午了吧，他的手仍無法抽出來
It was about noon, and he still hadn’t pulled his hand out.

S.FORM: karaan am, to rana bazángbang rana o lima na a om-lipad am, om-lavi rana o k-anak-an ori,
S.TRANSL: 他的手紅腫了，小孩子急哭了
The child’s hand had become swollen, and he started to cry

S.FORM: ta ka-teng-an na rana o ka-ji na maka-hap-an rana so lima na ori a.
S.TRANSL: 因為他知道他的手沒辦法抽出來了
because he knew he couldn’t get it out.

S.FORM: ma-nakem na rana sira, ta “si mi-pono o henep ya am, apia ko ya? ji abo ka-viay ko si mi-pono o henep ya”,
S.TRANSL: 他也想到，“如果滿潮的話，我一定會死掉的，我怎麼辦？”
“If the tide comes, what should I do? If the tide rises, I won’t live!” the child thought.

S.FORM: ji rana agag do va-vahay o lima na, ta om-lipad rana ori,
S.TRANSL: 由於手已腫脹，沒辦法從洞裡抽出來了
As his hand became even more swollen, (it was wedged tightly) and couldn’t slip out.

S.FORM: ta to na gowgád-an o lima na am, ori ji na rana maka-hap-i so lima na ori a.
S.TRANSL: 因為他一直動他的手，所以手無法抽出來
As his hand rubbed against the sides of the hole, he couldn’t get it out.

S.FORM: ma-cíta na no ma-ngay do keysakan a asa ka tao a ra-rakeh ori am, “a síno ori o ya mi-pi-patotog do Kasngenan a ya mi-gi-gowgaw ori a, síno ori?”
S.TRANSL: 有位老人去海邊，看見了他，心想“誰在Kasngenan那裡倒立摸洞啊？”
An elder happened to walk toward the sea. When he saw (the child), he thought, “Who is that? Why is he upside-down with his hand in the hole?”

S.FORM: ikongodo ji na ni-ma-ziman no mi-gowgaw a k-anak-an ori o am-ian do likod na ori a ra-rakeh ori a,
S.TRANSL: 由於小孩子沒有察覺到後面來了一個老人家
The child who was probing the hole didn’t even notice the elder’s approach from his back.

S.FORM: “tolok ka!” koan na no ra-rakeh am, ma-’ogto o k-anak-an am, mi na to na voznót-a o lima na am, mi na toda a-óyot rana o lima na,
S.TRANSL: 結果老人“嘟 露個” 一聲加上輕戳小孩屁股的動作，讓小孩子嚇得把手一抽（扯），結果就抽出來了
The elder poked the child’s bottom, and the child was so frightened that he pulled up hard, and his hand came out of the hole.

S.FORM: “ayayay! ayoy ta apia rana, ayoy ta ma-hap ko rana o lima ko, ayoy ta ma-hap ko rana o lima ko”.
S.TRANSL: “呀呀叫，痛死了；謝謝，太好了，終於把手抽出來了，謝謝，我的手抽出來了”
At first he was crying out in pain, then he turned and said, “Thank you, thank you, this is wonderful! I finally pulled my hand out!”

S.FORM: ji na ni-’oya o ni-t-om-olok sia ori, ta i-saray na jia,
S.TRANSL: 他不僅沒有責怪嚇到他，又用手指戳他屁股的老人，反而去感謝他
Not only did he not yell at the person who scared and poked him, but instead he kept on thanking him,

S.FORM: ta “ayoy ta ma-viay ko a, ayoy ta ma-viay ko a, ayoy ta ma-hap ko rana o lima ko, oyod a ma-viay ko” koan na no likey a k-anak-an ang.
S.TRANSL: “謝謝你，讓我能夠繼續的活著，謝謝你，終於讓我手抽出來，我真的能活著？！” 小孩子說
saying, “Thank you for saving me! Thank you for saving me! I finally got my hand out. I’m so glad to be alive.”

S.FORM: “ka ni-ma-takzes, mo koimo ang” koan na no ra-rakeh a.
S.TRANSL: “怎麼了，小鬼，有病啊！” 老人說
“Hey, kid, what’s your problem?” the elder asked.

S.FORM: “na, yaken rana ya am, ya ni-s-om-let o lima ko am, ayoy ta mi mo yaken aviay-in a,
S.TRANSL: “哦，我呢，剛才我的手卡在洞裡了；謝謝你來救我(讓我還能活著)
“Oh, I just had my hand stuck in the hole, and thanks for saving my life.

S.FORM: ayoy ta m-owyot ko rana o lima ko a ya ni-s-om-let do va-vahay ang, ya ni-s-om-let ya do va-vahay, mo Kaminan (mo Maran)” koan na.
S.TRANSL: 非常感謝，我的手終於從洞裡的拔出來了。剛才我的手卡在洞裡呢，阿姨（叔叔），” 他說
Thanks a lot! I manged to pull my hand out that got stuck in the hole. My hand got stuck in the hold, Auntie/Uncle.”

S.FORM: “ayoy!” koan na am, ji rana maka-ziak ori a s-om-aray no mina ka-viay na rana, mina ka-oli do inawan na,
S.TRANSL: 他高興得除了會說“謝謝” 以外，別的話也想不出來了。他真的很高興撿回他自己的命
Other than “thank you,” there really wasn’t anything that he could say. He was very happy that he was still alive.

S.FORM: ta no mina abo o ra-rakeh ori a ni-t-om-olok sia am, ji rana to ngian do dang, ta ma-kong so wajin jia si mi-pe-hnep?
S.TRANSL: 因為如果沒有那個老人的“指戳” 舉動，他一定淹死在那裡，因為若是滿潮了的話，他哪有辦法脫困
If the old man had not poked him, he would have drowned at the high tide because there was no way to get out.

S.FORM: am ori ni-saray-an na nia no likey a k-anak-an do ra-rakeh a ni-t-om-olok sia ori a, ha ha ha.
S.TRANSL: 這就是小孩子感激老人的“指戳” 他的原因。哈，哈，哈
Therefore the child was thankful that the elder poked him. Ha ha ha (laughing).

S.FORM: “oyod a ji ko a-viay ya” koan no likey a k-anak-an am, ori to na laví-i a om-gona-gonay so lima na ori am,
S.TRANSL: “我真的沒不能活了嗎？” 小孩子想到這裡就害怕的哭了起來，於是不斷的抽動他的手
“Oh, will I really not live?” As the child thought of this, he was so scared that he kept crying and tried even harder to pull it out.
